thread.title: WEEK 8: Surprises abound in wild night of prep football
thread.title_full: WEEK 8: Surprises abound in wild night of prep football

author: Jeff Hart
title: WEEK 8: Surprises abound in wild night of prep football
text:
By Jeff Hart Sports Reporter Rabun County players celebrate after a touchdown during the Wildcats' 49-3 win over Union County on Friday in Tiger. photo: Bobby Escoe Related Articles 2015 High school football rankings 2015 High School Football region standings VIDEO: Rabun County routs Union County in top 10 showdown, 49-3 VIDEO: Banks County holds on to beat Lumpkin County, moves into crowded 7-AAA race 
On a night when teams atop their respective regions were supposed to begin tuning up for the playoffs, the memos to everyone else apparently got lost in the mail. 
Gainesville was stunned by Clarke Central 44-7 in a key Region 8- contest and Fannin County whipped Dawson County 31-15 just a week after the Tigers looked to be taking control in Region 7-AAA. Winder-Barrow scored the final 20 points to rally for a its third straight win over Cedar Shoals, 30-25, in 8- to pull into fourth place. 
And -- in the most anticipated matchup on the night -- Rabun County turned its top 10 battle for Region 8-AA supremacy into a rout, as the Wildcats jumped on the Panthers early and ran away with a shocking 49-3 victory in Tiger. 
Some teams, however, either continued their climb up their respective region standings or got back in the playoff race. 
In Region 8-AAA, Hart County scored three fourth quarter touchdowns to rally past Jackson County 41-24 in a big win for the Bulldogs, who take on No. 3 Jefferson in the season finale. The Dragons also rolled to a 49-0 win over East Jackson to stay undefeated. 
Flowery Branch won its second straight Region 8- game with a solid 41-6 victory over Apalachee while in Region 7-AAA. Banks County won for the fourth time in five games, holding off Lumpkin County 48-31 to set up a huge showdown next week with Dawson County. Also in 7-AAA, Franklin County used a pair of fourth quarter touchdowns to take a 21-14 win over West Hall to deal the Spartans a big blow to their playoff chances while keeping their region title hopes alive coupled with Dawson Countyâ€™s loss. 
Class AAA third-ranked Jefferson routed East Jackson 49-0 to stay atop Region 8-AAA and Lanier pulled away for a 42-0 win over Heritage, Conyers to remain the only unbeaten team in Region 8- . 
In Region 8-AAAA, Buford stayed unbeaten with a 51-0 victory over Monroe Area at home and Stephens County also remained perfect with a 40-21 win over Chestatee at The Reservation. 
North Hall rebounded from its loss to Buford last week with a huge road win over Madison County, 56-28, to stay alive in 8-AAAA. North Oconee got its best defensive effort of the season in taking a 20-0 victory over White County. 
Habersham Central never quit but eventually fell to Centennial 42-35 on the road in Region 6- . Oglethorpe County snapped an eight-game losing streak with a 21-16 win over Riverside Military in Region 8-AA action. 
In Region 8-A, Commerce whipped Providence Christian 45-0; Athens Academy took a 44-10 victory over Lakeview Academy; and No. 2 Prince Avenue rolled over Towns County 42-14. 
Be sure to check out our Friday Game Night page for in-depth game stories and video highlights from throughout the night's action in northeast Georgia. 
WEEK 8 HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL SCORES, Oct. 16 
Athens Academy 44, Lakeview Academy 10 
Banks County 48, Lumpkin County 31 
Buford 51, Monroe Area 0 
Centennial 42, Habersham Central 35 
Clarke Central 44, Gainesville 7 
Commerce 45, Providence Christian 0 
East Hall 24, Johnson 14 
Flowery Branch 41, Apalachee 6 
Franklin County 21, West Hall 14 
Hart County 41, Jackson County 24 
Jefferson 49, East Jackson 0 
Johns Creek 17, North Forsyth 14 
North Hall 56, Madison County 28 
North Oconee 20, White County 0 
Oglethorpe County 21, Riverside Military 16 
Prince Avenue Christian 42, Towns County 14 
Rabun County 49, Union County 3 
Stephens County 40, Chestatee 21 
Winder-Barrow 30, Cedar Shoals 25
